monster.name: The Possessed

entries: The Possessed are created in a Lazarus Wave event, a phenomenon first discovered by Arcanist Luren Insoren during her Lazarus Project. While most victims exposed to Argent biowaves will expire without further effect, some subjects will absorb traces of Argent energy and enter a state of posthumous vigor. Despite necrosis on the internal organs (with the exception of the brain), the victim continues to animate and exhibit a low order of sentinence for weeks or even months after death. Posthumous brain activity in the possessed is limited to instinctive behavior. The possessed are known to be territorial when confronted by the living. When isolated, they will often enter a dormant state for extended periods of time. They will stand, unmoving, for days or weeks at a time until presented with a live food source, or threatened by a predator.
{@b Fodder:} The possessed are considered the lowest form of demon, and act as front-line fodder for their armies. They are rarely encountered alone, and can overwhelm unprepared adventurers.
{@b Ashes to Ashes:} When the posessed is destroyed, its body crumbles to ash, along with any clothing it was wearing.

senses: tremorsense 30 ft. ({@condition blinded|phb|blind} beyond this radius)

trait.name: Vindictive Death
entries: If damage reduces the the possessed to 0 hit points, it releases the Argent energy trapping its soul. Each creature within 5 feet of the the possessed must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) Argent/fire damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludeoning damage. If the target is Medium or smaller, they must make a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

Despite their low status among the demon ranks and their seemingly endless number, imps have unique characteristics in battle. Some prefer fighting from an elevated position, while others will rush their target and swipe at them with razor sharp claws. Walls and obstacles offer no defense against imps as they will leap great heights and easily hang from surfaces. The imp is capable of channeling Argent energy through its hands and shaping it into a projectile. As the imp channels the energy, airborn particles and debris are sucked into the malestrom to create a condensed, superheated fireball. The mechanics of the imp's ranged attacks suggest that they are actually a lower form of the {@creature summoner|doom}.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The demonic imp has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Leap
entries: During its movement, the demonic imp may leap up to the remaining distance in its movement in any direction, including up. If the imp leaps to a wall or other vertical surface, it can dig one of its claws into the surface and remain there until it leaps to another location.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The demonic imp has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the demonic imp's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The demonic imp makes two attacks with its claws.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d8 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hurl Hellfire
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 80/100 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) Argent/fire damage.

action.name: Charged Hellfire
entries: The demonic imp may choose to hold its hurled hellfire for 1 round before releasing it. If it does so, the target takes an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) Argent/fire damage on a successful hit. However, if the demonic imp takes any damage when taking this action before releasing the hellfire, the attack is lost and the demonic imp cannot attempt to use this ability again until the end of its next turn.

These demonic animals are unnamed by those in Hell. They were colloquially named pinkies, due to their unusual skin pigmentation, when first discovered by the Lazarus Project's Tethering Operation. Their aggressive nature against the living is well-documented.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the pinky moves at least 10 ft. straight toward a target and then hits it with a tail swipe attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.
If the pinky uses this ability, it can only move in a straight line this turn and stops once it has struck a creature or object.

trait.name: Hard Head
entries: The pinky's skull has an extra layer of bone covering it. This acts as a shield against any attack made from the front, granting it DR 5 against physical attacks made by a creature that the pinky is facing.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The pinky has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the pinkie's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pinky makes two attacks, one bite and one tail swipe.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail Swipe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

The hell razer is an astute and tactical foe that will engage enemies from a distance with a powerful beam of unrefined Argent energy. The beam emanates from an arm-like protrusion composed of cartilage and other osseous tissue. Articulation of the cartilage allows the hell razer to focus its energy beam into a single charged shot that will obiterate anything that stands in its path.

trait.name: Rake
entries: Any target hit by at least two of the hell razer's claw attacks in one turn must make a successful {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or begin to bleed, losing 2 ({@dice 1d4}) hit points at the start of its next 5 turns. A creature affected by this ability may make repeat the saving throw again at the end of each of its turns.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hell razer makes three attacks with its claw, or one attack with its claw and either a {@i hell razer} or {@i hell beam} attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d8 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hell Razer (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The hell razer releases pure Argent energy in a beam encompassing a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 33 ({@dice 6d10}) Argent/fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Hell Beam (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The hell razer releases pure Argent in a 60-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@dice 5d8}) Argent/fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
